trustfund:
TF057459-PAKISTAN EARTHQUAKE DISASTER
            RECOVERY TRUST FUND

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Earthquake Disability
            Project for Pakistan were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: teams preparing emergency projects
            need to consider how to strike the balance between emergency
            objectives and longer term institution-building approaches
            and policy reforms and whether combining these two
            objectives makes sense. Project preparation should allow
            implementation to begin immediately after effectiveness,
            particularly in emergency operations. Therefore, issues such
            as financial flows, terms of reference for consultancies and
            procurement should be in place by project effectiveness. A
            results framework with measurable indicators needs to be in
            place as well as a functioning monitoring system, including
            arrangements for a timely impact analysis. Project results
            that are immediately relevant to the beneficiaries, their
            families and communities, and the public at large, are an
            effective means of building and expanding support for
            disability programs.
